author: ajsutton
content: Looks like the only thing left for Teku on v0.12 is to implement the stricter checks for rpc size limits and accept rpc error responses as bytes not strings.  I don't think either would cause incompatibilities - we'd just accept more messages than we should (probably reject them later in processing) and potentially record a bunch of gibberish error reasons in logs but Java is very forgiving when reading UTF-8.

author: djrtwo
content:
Nice @adrian
Makes sense. Have yall run any internal nets or simulations with the v0.12 branch?

author: nishant0
content: nice, Is this all already merged onto your master branch ? <@!340345049063882753>

author: ajsutton
content: It's on the 0.12.1-integration branch currently. Passes the reference tests but we haven't done any serious testing on it yet.  The key networking changes for compatibility with other clients has only just landed recently (naming of attestation topics and potentially a couple of other bits).

author: nishant0
content: ok great thanks, will try that branch out for v0.12 then.

author: nishant0
content:
also just to clarify this log 
```
10:45:36.456 INFO  - Minimum genesis time reached
```
does it mean we already have the final genesis state ?

author: ajsutton
content: I missed that last question here and wound up answering on a different discord...  But for the record no that means we found an ETH1 block that satisfied the minimum genesis time condition.  We still need to meet the mininum validators condition.  I've put up a PR to clarify the message.
